front.reference:
International Journal of Modern Physics E
Vol. 24, No. 2 (2015) 1550008 (17 pages)

docTitle.titlePart:
A combination of hadronic form factors for modeling
the kaon photoproduction process γp → K
+ Λ

front.address:
Departemen Fisika, FMIPA,
Universitas Indonesia, Depok 16424, Indonesia
front.note:
Received 9 November 2014
Revised 16 December 2014
Accepted 9 January 2015
Published 11 February 2015
front.div:
We have phenomenologically investigated the kaon photoproduction process γp → K + Λ
by combining different types of hadronic form factors (HFFs) inside a covariant isobar
model. We obtained the best model with the smallest χ 2 /N by using the dipole form
factor in the Born terms and a combination of the dipole, Gaussian, as well as generalized
dipole form factors in the hadronic vertices of the nucleon, kaon and hyperon resonances.
By utilizing this model we found that the experimental data used in the analysis are
internally consistent, whereas the behavior of differential cross-section at forward angles
is not significantly affected by the variation of hadronic coupling constants (CCs) and
form factor cutoffs in the model.
front.keyword: Keywords: Kaon; hadronic form factor; photoproduction.
